[6]I know if I put my mind to it I could be one of the great writers of musical lyrics not that I can write melodies - and I try - and then I hear the songs he writes and I realize I'll never write a great lyric and that my talent really lies in drinking. 
[7]I know what you're thinking - this is boring - I agree - I'm ready to move on - let's do Bricktop's, Scott, I'm bored, he's bored, we're all bored. 
[8]Une bouteille de bourbon. 
[9]Did you read my story?   What did you think? 
[10]I might've known you'd hate it. 
[11]You liked the story but he hates me. 
[12]I'm jumpy - suddenly I don't like the atmosphere here anymore. Where are you going? 
[13]He's going to St. Germain.   I'm going with him. 
[14]If you're going to stay and drink with him I'm going with the toreador. 
[15]Please leave me alone.   I don't want to live. 
[16]It all became clear to me tonight. Scott and that beautiful Countess - it was so obvious they were whispering about me and the more they drank the more he fell in love with her. 
[17]No, he's tired of me. 
[18]How?   How? 
[19]But you just met us. How can you know anything. My skin hurts. I hate the way I look. 
[20]What is this? 
[21]I never heard of Valium.   What is this? 
[22]But pills wear off - and then it all comes back. No, I won't kill myself. I'll write and I'll write more passionately than Scott. I'll work harder.
dialogues.SCOTT:
[1]Scott Fitzgerald, and who are you old sport? 
[2]As what? 
[3]Scott and Zelda Fitzgerald. The Fitzgeralds. Isn't she beautiful? 
[4]What kind of books do you write? 
[5]I'm sorry - Don't you know the host? Some friends have gotten together a little party for Jean Cocteau. 
[6]Whatever you say, sweetheart. See if Cole and Linda want to come with. Coming? 
[7]Greetings and salutations. You'll forgive me - I've been mixing grain and grappa ··· This is Gil - Gil? Yes, Gil. 
[8]In New York you can't buy this - it can only be made in a bathtub - and some of the bathtub mixtures are damn good - Isn't that so? She prefers her hootch from a homemade still - more kick. 
[9]Darling you're too sensitive. 
[10]Please old sport - you make matters extremely difficult. 
[11]Zelda - 
[12]Get her back at a reasonable time. 
[13]She's exciting - and she has talent. 
[14]Can we not discuss my personal life in public? 
[15]You don't understand her. 
[16]Stop it. 
[17]I'm going to find Zelda. I don't like the thought of her with the Spaniard.
dialogues.GABRIELLE:

dialogues.CAROL:

[11]Back home we just joined a marvelous tennis club and Paul says you play. Does Gil?

dialogues.DALI:
[1]We met earlier tonight.    At the party. 
[2]Dali - si? Dali! Dali!      Une bouteille de vin rouge I

[4]I paint rhinoceros. I paint you - sad eyes - big lips - melting over hot sand - with one tear - yes - and in your tear - Christ's face. And rhinoceros.

dialogues.GAUGUIN:
